Evaluation_Questions: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken
What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback
The instructor established a positive learning environment
The instructor raised questions or problems that encouraged me to think critically
Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List: 3-5 hours.

The readings usually took me between 1 - 2 hours each week. For the take-home final exam, I probably spent anywhere between 12 - 18 hours on it (though I didn't keep track... I split up the assigned essays and worked on them on different days).
0.5 hour

Overall, the topics covered were very interesting and the professors were great. In the future, the course could be improved by having participation or class attendance be part of the overall grade. Would be great to have had a more robust discussion from the class.
An introduction class t occupational and environmental health. Good for someone who does not have much experience about this topic.
Poorly attended but lectures were as interesting as they could be for this SBS student. A good way to get the Occ Med requirement out of the way without getting too much into the weeds.
great exposure to occupational health.

I really enjoyed this course! Unlike many others I've taken at YSPH, Mark and Marty cultivated a warm, supportive, and inclusive environment in the classroom. They were interested in students' perspectives, and their lectures were interesting and engaging.
Great class, awesome instructors! It was very engaging and a good class environment.
This class is very friendly for students that have no idea of occupational medicine.

Unfortunately, this class is mainly taken to fulfill the environmental course credit, and therefore students are not invested in the class at all. The class was already small to begin with so many students just stopped showing up. It's not that the professors were bad, but that it's a topic students aren't interested in. I don't know if there could be any way to make the environmental health courses more appealing to other department students, but it would definitely be something to look into because pretty much all the students I've talked to have dreaded the course they had to take to fulfill that requirement.
I thought Prof Russi did a great job--very knowledgable and always available to answer questions.
Very informative lectures. The study cases and readings are interesting.

Both Mark and Marty are very kind, very enthusiastic and clearly enjoy teaching the course. They seem to appreciate the learning for learning's sake, and don't get bogged down in attendance, assignments, etc.
very smart man.
Mark was wonderful! His lectures were well-organized and thoughtful, and I appreciate his wealth of medical and epidemiological experience.
I really enjoyed learning from him! He was very friendly and engaging
Nice and patient
Professor Russi was incredibly kind and his knowledge and expertise were definitely exemplified. He was very patient and encouraged students to try to find an interest in the topics we were covering.
I thought Prof Slade did a great job--very knowledgable and always available to answer questions.
Very fun way of teaching. Deliver the contents and research to students pretty well.

Both Mark and Marty are very kind, very enthusiastic and clearly enjoy teaching the course. They seem to appreciate the learning for learning's sake, and don't get bogged down in attendance, assingments, etc.
bright and comical...
Marty is fantastic! He's an engaging lecturer and understands how to involve students in classroom discussions. (He's also hilarious!)
I really enjoyed learning from him as well! Very helpful and engaging
interesting and funny

Professor Slade was a good lecturer, but I'm not sure if his teaching style was met with the response it needed given our very small class size. There would be periods of silence sometimes, but that part would be more on us the students. It was just difficult to engage with the material when most of us didn't have an interest for it.
Great course to take if you're interested in occupational/environmental health
I would recommend this class.
Easy, interesting, a good way to fulfill the occ med requirement if occ med is not your jam.
great class.

This course wasn't a lot of work at all, but it was engaging and interesting. I really enjoyed the assigned readings, and I thought the lectures were interesting. Mark and Marty covered fascinating topics - and I liked the 'case study' approach - where each week was a different topic and focus (there was something for everyone!).
Definitely, the material is so interesting!
It's an easy class for the EHS requirement.
